summary.purpose: Provides a customizable progress bar component built on Radix UI's Progress primitive with support for displaying percentage values and custom styling.
summary.problem_solved: Simplifies creating accessible progress bars by wrapping Radix UI's Progress primitive with pre-styled container and indicator, optional percentage display, and flexible styling for different use cases.

external.name: @radix-ui/react-progress
external.why_used: Provides the accessible Progress primitive with semantic HTML and ARIA attributes

external.name: react
external.why_used: Core React library for component creation, forwardRef, and JSX rendering

internal.why_used: Provides the cn() utility function for conditionally merging CSS classes

exports.name: ProgressComponent
exports.description_one_line: Customizable progress bar with optional percentage display

symbols.name: ProgressComponent
symbols.description_one_line: Accessible progress bar component with optional value display and custom styling

params.name: value
params.description: Progress value as a percentage (0-100). If not provided, defaults to 0.

params.name: showValue
params.description: Whether to display the percentage value inside the progress indicator. Defaults to false.

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with the root progress bar container styles

params.name: containerClassName
params.description: Optional CSS classes for the outer wrapper div (relative positioned container)

params.name: indicatorClassName
params.description: Optional CSS classes for the inner progress indicator bar (the filled portion)

params.name: showValueClassName
params.description: Optional CSS classes for the percentage text display when showValue is true

params.name: ...props
params.description: All standard Radix UI Progress Root props (min, max, getValueLabel, etc.)

returns.description: A styled progress bar component with optional percentage display

details.what_it_does: Renders a progress bar using Radix UI's ProgressPrimitive.Root and Indicator. The component creates a relative positioned container with a fixed-height progress bar. The indicator fills from left to right based on the value prop (0-100%). When showValue is true, displays the percentage text overlaid on the right side of the indicator with white text. Uses forwardRef to expose the underlying Radix progress element. Supports custom styling for the container, progress bar, and value text through className props.
details.rendered_ui_description: A horizontal progress bar with light gray background (bg-[#e5e7eb]), green fill color, and rounded corners. Height is 20px (h-5). When showValue is true, displays white percentage text (0-100%) on the right side of the filled portion. The indicator width grows from 0% to 100% based on the value prop with a smooth transition animation.

minimal_correct.title: Basic progress bar at 50%

extensive_correct.title: Progress bar with value display and custom styling

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Value exceeding 100%
incorrect.why_incorrect: The progress bar expects a value between 0 and 100 representing a percentage. Values above 100 will cause visual overflow and incorrect percentage display. Always clamp or validate the value to the 0-100 range before passing to the component.
